content: pony beads thank you for your interest in my pattern this pattern has not been tested so if you find typographical or numerical errors please inform me so i can correct it i can be contacted via facebook or instagram happy hooking finished size each bead is about 2 tall x 3 wide materials worsted weight #4 yarn held together 6mm hook needle scissors gauge not necessary but your finished size may vary stitches us terms slip_stitch -slip_stitch chain -chain skip -skip single_crochet -single_crochet space -space half_double_crochet -half_double_crochet st -stitch pattern notes this is a pattern to simply make a crochet version of pony beads and the cord used to string them you can use the diagrams below to assemble your beads or any other diagrams available online the pattern was written for using worsted weight held together but if you want a smaller bead and cord you can use a single strand and a 4 5mm hook designed by crochet by those_yellow_things your source for unique handmade items beads chain 20 slip_stitch to first st to form ring round 1 chain 1 half_double_crochet in same chain chain 1 skip chain *half_double_crochet in next chain chain 1 skip chain* 9 times slip_stitch to join to firm half_double_crochet 10 half_double_crochet 10 chain-sps round 2 8 slip_stitch to next chain 1 space chain 1 half_double_crochet in same space chain 1 skip st *half_double_crochet in next space chain 1 skip st* 9 times slip_stitch to join to first half_double_crochet 10 half_double_crochet 10 chain-sps fold the tube up inside itself so that the first round is on the inside this will form a ring -> aka the bead round 9 working through both round 8 and round 1 chain 1 single_crochet in each st and chain space around fasten_off 20 make as many beads as needed for your intended project cord round 1 chain 5 starting in 2nd chain from hook half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in next 3 chs chain 1 turn 4 round 2 half_double_crochet in each st across chain 1 turn 4 repeat round 2 until cord is as long as you need it tip it is okay to overshoot and pull out some length once you get all the beads strung alternatively if you string your beads and need more length on either side of the cord simply join your yarn to the end and add some length to either side designed by crochet by those_yellow_things your source for unique handmade items diagrams you may use these diagrams below the colors match my pictured crochet projects if you need help learning how to string the beads check out some great tutorials found online feel free to use
